result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robyn Rachel Richardson

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($1,000.00) LW

Defendant Robyn Rachel Richardson not in court.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for return on warrant.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court orders bail to be forfeited.

The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 10-20-2022.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court takes no action on bail at this time.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means. Case in court for calendar call.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
Justice Point Pretrial Services DISCHARGE Report, received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.

Defendant Robyn Rachel Richardson not in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  
Court notes counsel has left the PD's office and new counsel has not been appointed yet. 
Case adjourned to Br. 37.  Calendar call scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, received and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Frank W.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

ADDRESS INFO for Robyn Rachel Richardson
Current: 1220 W. Vliet St, Milwaukee, WI 53205   (Effective: 03-19-2022)
Prior: 5230 North Sherman Boulevard, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Defendant Robyn Rachel Richardson in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Robyn Rachel Richardson in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robyn Rachel Richardson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
